intro: Chaetocalyx longiflorus, commonly known as the long-flowered silky-laurel, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
